Prompted by a quick article in the paper, I decided to perform some more research on the topic of whether or not milk is actually good for you. I came across this article on the internet:
 
 http://www.mercola.com/2000/feb/27/no_milk.htm
 
 I recall a classmate doing his research paper on this subject, his stand was also against the "healthy" effects of milk.

post_info.post_title: Is milk actually good for you?

I make no claims to the validity of this site, but another site to check out is this:
 
 www.notmilk.com
my mother in law who is a nurse of 30 years experience says that milk is very healthy for you, though you should propably drink low fat, or decrease your consumption some when you get older.

I've heard for years that milk (calcium) is good for you. I've heard also for years that milk (fat) is bad for you. Is this an argument for low-fat (or no-fat) milk? Or maybe Caltrate?
 
 Incidently, there was not too long ago a study that concluded bacon (the burnt part) was bad for you. Of course they used rats in the study and concluded that you'd have to eat 70 pounds of burnt bacon a week to have the same dose of bad stuff...and everybody knows that if you drink 200 gallons of water in one hour, you will die.
 
 Additionally, a chemist friend of mine says that oxygen is actually what causes us to deteriorate and age. Can't live without it, can't live with it.
 
 I drink no-fat and 1% milk when I don't really want to taste the unmistakable goodness of whole milk.
 
 Which is worse for you...an 8oz glass of whole milk or a 16oz New York Strip?

my mother in law who is a nurse of 30 years experience says that milk is very healthy for you, though you should propably drink low fat, or decrease your consumption some when you get older.

 
 Everything I've read on the subject basically says the same thing. Switch to low or no-fat milk (Saturated fat is still believed to be linked to heart disease), and if your body can tolerate it (many are lactose intolerant, or just don't seem to do well drinking a lot of milk later in life), it's not something you need to avoid.
 
 You can do without milk, there are plenty of other ways to get vitD and calcium. But low-fat/no fat is not inherently considered bad for your health. Seriously, I dont' know what I'd do without a bowl of skim milk+cereal in the morning. Well, OK, two bowls of that.
 
 -Mach

Considering what goes on inside a modern feedlot....I wouldn't jump so easily to a yes answer. 
 
 The Europeans banned hormones for a reason. No US milk can legally be shipped to Europe for the health complications these additions chemicals the industry has added for their profit caused in humans. 
 
 Wow, I'm never drinking milk again 
 
 Very, very, very scary.

Incidently, there was not too long ago a study that concluded bacon (the burnt part) was bad for you. Of course they used rats in the study and concluded that you'd have to eat 70 pounds of burnt bacon a week to have the same dose of bad stuff...and everybody knows that if you drink 200 gallons of water in one hour, you will die.

 
 Yes, this is also how they can say "studies show that marijuana is bad for you."
 The gave rats 200 times the normal dose. Even at 100 times the normal dose, there were no adverse effects.
